I kind of have another experiences being the spouse like Randy mentioned being doing military my husband is active duty ah for the army and and the reserve so we have an experience of being in the reserves but also being with active duty so we move around just as much as an active duty of
Family might so we have the experiences of children going through separation
A separation anxiety isolation you know and how it how does impact their social functioning I'm self you know whether it's with their self esteem or their confidence levels so it presents another challenge I think in the parental aspect
'em knowing when to to bring in outside support when to ask for that support and then how do we even though our community because we're moving around as often as we do um so being in the reserves on that side
Being a spouse at that being the spouse of an active duty person and being in the reserve
The difficulty for me can be seen like in the form of career progression
So say you get out of the military active duty and you know where you want to go or even if you don't know where you want to go if you're geographically located in one place you might have a good idea of the resources you might have a great idea of where you want to work out things like that but being in the reserves and then also being a spouse of an active duty member
You know you you move from place to place and that natural career progression isn't always there and I think can be said in the reserves so you go from different unit to different unit and that career progression on the military side it's often difficult to come by
So there's there's multiple challenges and being in the reserves a balancing it with your family life balancing it with your civilian work balancing it with your children like it's it's
I Would not say it's easy at all
But a hopeless all worth it
Right definitely so through the reserves that have been able to you know get my education paid for I've been able to you know reap the benefits of the G. I. bill tuition assistance [noise] um I wouldn't be here working at courage to call today if it weren't with uh all the support that I've had in the military
Do me about the name courage to call up became the name for this
Yet so courage to call actually started in two thousand nine and so that predates both Christina and I buy it kinda goes it stems from like having that courage to make that call because there is such a stigma even still today like we said earlier with asking for that
Help and so the courage to call the thing that they can do is it can be as simple as hey I just need this resource to all the way to how do I use my GI Bill to I Need some intense
Help with my post traumatic stress and everything in between so courage for the call is really just that having the courage to call and speak to another fellow veteran has the line is operated on the whole team is either a veteran or spouses and so having the courage to call somebody and reach out and get the help
That you need there what is the number to call so you can
Go to our website which is courage to called dot org the number two and Christina has the phone number
The phone number is one eight seven seven six nine eight seven eight three eight that's a toll free number um and you can also call to one one option for
The ... review that are from Asia before the closer the program you mentioned the Christian in a moment ago about the cubes and and the the children of separation that occurs ... that occurs are there programs that help children as well through through the eyes
Would definitely so when we meet a for different coalition meetings there's programs there's grants out there that help children be involved in sports there's there's programs that help kids go to a summer camps
They can do these things but you know it's just being aware of the resources that are there so if we have any military families that are they're really
Struggling with their children like that's been gone mom is dressed as on deployment mom doesn't know who to turn to because mom isn't a new place and doesn't really have a supportive network get
And the kids are really upset they're acting out there's definitely other children that are feeling the same way so if we can connect those children to other children uh through programs um that that really pay for it
And alleviate a lot of the stress and provide some therapeutic environments for the children and that's what we want to do we want to link families with the resources that are really going to benefit
Them but it's great when you watch on television the returns from deployments you know and love the spouses ... woman gets off the ship and there's all this joy
And then I ... at a time when they go back home and they have to go to get back into life over again there are those moments that are not maybe is pleasant as we bought the families like that but they feel they can they become isolated easily
Absolutely yeah absolutely and I also as 'cause see I thought I was also dual military for many years so my husband was on active duty and at the same time I was
And coming home and it it's easy to just get into your world your bubble of taking care of yourself and to isolate and and nobody else understands I'm what you do and we even as veterans tend to do that we tend to hoard up and get together as veterans and
Because we're the only ones that are going to understand what we're going through and so it's really important to break through that both for our families and for the veterans and tried to get out there and read um integrate into the entire says
No you guys for ... for veterans to get together for ... and move spouses and men and women to give give
Absolutely and one of the things that Christina was highlighting is that's amazing about courage to call is because there's so many resources specific to families specific to the veteran or active duty service member instead of trying to call Fifteen different places
They can call one place and we can do a basic screening and tell you what would be appropriate for you instead of you having to call
Oh no I'm not eligible for them and I'm not eligible for that when they can literally call in to us to our line and they can speak with a fellow veterans that is going to be able to say hey no you know what you're eligible this is the best fit for your situation 'cause
I'm as we said earlier every veteran's experience every military family is it a different experience though I was a Navy I was attached to army unit so my experience is not the same as Christine us but mine is also not the same as a fellow sailors so
Every experience is different and it's important that if they call in and we can help them find what is appropriate for them in their family
People listening to you guys right now most feel very encouraged by what you're saying and where they can get some help and how can people help I mean Richard volunteers with the organization and I would imagine that the donations to the organization helps as well open people do that
So so there's multiple ways they can donate through for clothing through the um listing that we had that operation dress code dot com but also if they go to courage the number to call dot org and they can go in there because the reality is is this is all free to our service members
On so we take donations monetary donations as well so if they maybe can't come out and volunteer maybe they've been out of this a business world for a while and they don't have close to donate we need hangers we need other things that we buy for that day the racks
Things like that that all costs money so maybe volunteering ours isn't work for them but they have the option of also don't

... ... it's incredible to watch what's going on
Back for the past half century Ninety percent of black voters have cast their ballots for Democrats a national elections even though it's against their self interest
The Democrats have consistently opposed go choice trapping kids and failing public schools for generations they've ... Democrats have promoted illegal immigration which is destroyed black working class jobs and champion Bill Clinton's crow NAFTA policies

And this was all said in a sense to CNN's Don Lemon

Or use other racial pejorative against them they wouldn't be kicked off said but not when their own get to do it and they do it with such ... and you know when you think back in history
Which CNN did the Kanye West borrows from an ugly ugly and tragic history of slavery and the pre civil war you see white slave owners who wrote Democrats ruthlessly
Punished any black man or woman who sought to educate themselves and think for themselves
The Democrat white slave owners in the south headed control blacks maintaining power over them and after the civil war ended conducted by Democrats
Slave owners head to release their slaves but they formed the Ku Klux Klan Democrats formed the Ku Klux Klan as terrorists arm of the Democratic party
To intimidate murder Lynch suppressed and destroy any political activities of the newly freed black population to keep them under control if they threaten the Democratic power structure believe me the Democrats and the Ku Klux Klan went after them hard
Later on in the era of Jim Crow why Democrats codify into law the idea of literacy test
And other means and methods to dumb down and keep African Americans poorly educated and keep them all in line
To protect their power Ninety five percent of black people continually vote for Democrats
Because the ... media like the CNN and ABC NBC and CBS control black Americans to keep them in line to keep them under control we're while I watch free thinking African American men and women be personally destroyed
By CNN and the mainstream media Democratic Party
And so then I look at the results of the Trump Administration black unemployment historically low criminal justice reform is coming
He's fighting against illegal immigration that hurts black workers he's trying to find a solution to the never ending slaughter
Of black men by other black men in Chicago dominated only by the Democratic party and he's going to try to make it possible for Democrats to sit down at the table of equal economic opportunity and so what happened and Kanye West is the same crap that's happened to Clarence Thomas
